name: Mattermost Managed Bug Bounty Engagement Public
tagline: Mattermost is a leading collaboration platform for mission-critical work, serving national security, government, and critical infrastructure enterprises, offering secure, secure, and integrated collaboration experiences across various platforms.

target_groups.name: In Scope

targets.name: Mattermost Plugin for Microsoft Teams Meetings

target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Mattermost is an open-source collaboration and messaging platform designed for secure and efficient team communications. It allows team members to communicate in real-time through channels, direct messages, and group chats. In addition to messaging, Mattermost includes Playbooks, which are customizable workflows that help teams standardize and automate processes, and Calls, a feature for audio communication directly within the platform. Additionally, it integrates with various tools and services via plugins (Github, GitLab, Zoom, Jira etc.) to streamline workflows. Mattermost offers both self-hosted and cloud deployment options. The target consists of a backend, a webapp, a desktop app and mobile apps (iOS & Android).

A free instance can be created by signing up at https://customers.mattermost.com/cloud/signup

Otherwise, the target can be installed locally with the following ways:

  • From source code: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost

  • Other installation options: https://mattermost.com/download/

  • Mattermost Jira Plugin - Two-way integration between Mattermost and Jira. Supports Jira to Mattermost notifications (channel subscriptions and personal notifications) and managing Jira issues in Mattermost (create issue, attaching messages to Jira issues, transition Jira issues, assign Jira issues)
    Source code: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-jira

  • Mattermost Zoom Plugin - Allows team members to initiate a Zoom meeting with a single click. All participants in a channel can easily join the Zoom meeting and the shared link is updated when the meeting is over.
    Source code: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-zoom

  • Mattermost GitHub Plugin - Two-way integration between Mattermost and GitLab. Offers real-time updates on commits, pull requests, issues and the ability to create GH issues from within Mattermost
    Source code: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-github

  • Mattermost GitLab Plugin - Two-way integration between Mattermost and GitLab. Offers real-time updates and notifications on new and closed merge requests, new and closed issues, and tag creation events.
    Source code: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-gitlab

  • Mattermost Calls Plugin - This really part of the primary target but it’s developed as a plugin. It enables voice calling and screen sharing functionality in Mattermost channels.
    Source code: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-calls

  • Mattermost Playbooks Plugin - This is also part of the primary target but is developed as a plugin. Playbooks in Mattermost provide structure, monitoring, and automation for team-based processes. They use configurable checklists to guide teams toward specific outcomes, triggering tasks based on keywords or actions. Playbooks can include automated/manual tasks, status updates, workflow dashboards, and retrospective reviews as part of their execution and completion.
    Source code: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-playbooks

  • Mattermost Boards plugin - A project management tool within the Mattermost platform that allows teams to organize, track, and collaborate on tasks visually, using a board-style layout similar to kanban.
    Source code: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-boards

  • Mattermost Copilot plugin - AI-powered tool that assists users by generating insights, summaries, and automated responses
    Source code: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-ai

  • Mattermost Microsoft Calendar Plugin - Two-way integration between Mattermost and Microsoft Outlook Calendar.
    Source code: https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-mscalendar

  • Mattermost Plugin for Microsoft Teams Meetings - Enables users to schedule, join, and manage Microsoft Teams meetings directly from the Mattermost platform
    Source code: https://github.com/mattermost-community/mattermost-plugin-msteams-meetings

name: Rapyd
tagline: We provide APIs that help integrate local payments and Fintech capabilities.

target_groups.name: Tier 3 In scope Premium
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
We pay the most and want to focus on Rapyd's API and the core of this program, the reward for valid critical and high API findings could be increased depending on the impact on Rapyd.

Documentation:

  • Working with Rapyd, In order to successfully send an API request you need to understand how our signature system is working (or use code samples) GitHub - RapydPayments/rapyd-request-signatures: When you send a request, you calculate the signature and insert the result into the signature header. When the platform receives the request, it performs the same signature calculation. If the resulting values do not match, the request is rejected, GitHub. If you'd prefer to start your testing immediately and not to have to implement the signature mechanism by yourself, please proceed by using our publicly available Postman collection, which implements it by default.
  • Getting inspired by our Postman collection of API Samples Rapyd API Collection & Testing with Postman API Documentation
  • Rapyd documentation website
  • Postman collection

NOTE: Only use the sandbox environment for API testing activities.

target_groups.name: Tier 2 In scope
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Dashboard

Rapyd's Dashboard is the place to manage and control your rapyd entities and perform actions such as - generating API keys, checking account balances, managing users, and making transactions.
We have a full sandbox mode environment to simulate every feature supported by the production mode (There's a little toggle button on the upper right part of the application

  1. Go to Rapyd Client Portal and create your sample user.
  2. Link to our Docs - Client Portal Overview

Checkout

Collecting payments is done by creating a checkout page. follow the instructions to learn how to create one Checkout Overview

Verify

How can I Test the Verify application?

  • Since Rapyd Verify is a service implemented into other websites (as an iframe) you need to test it as part of a live system, lucky you, we have it implemented in our dashboard application. (dashboard.rapyd.net)
  • You must create a sample account in the dashboard application and select the UK as the country (this service is only for users who select UK in their business)
  • After successfully logging in, select the Activate Account option on the menu

How to find Rapyd Verify IFrame Video
Link to our Docs - Verify docs

Our our-of-scope policy assets are ones hosted by a 3rd party, such as the described targets but not limited to.
Automation/scripts from any kind against support forms are completely out of scope.

name: Sophos
tagline: Responsible disclosure with rewards up to US$80,000

target_groups.name: Intercept X Endpoint (Windows) Special Target
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Sophos Endpoint Protection is a multi-component system where some parts run at the highest possible privilege. One of the design goals is to protect users of the endpoint from threats on the network, therefore remote compromise of Endpoint Protection components is of particular concern to Sophos.

Attacks meeting ALL of the following conditions are eligible for consideration of a maximum bounty of $80,000:

  • triggering execution of attacker-controlled code
  • in a high privilege context (Administrator or higher for Windows)
  • doing so remotely
  • doing so via Endpoint Protection components
  • no user interaction is necessary

Clear instructions for how to reproduce the finding are required.

Some examples of in and out of scope scenarios follow. These are intended to illustrate the above definition, not to limit it. Attacks that meet the definition will be in scope.

Examples:

In-scope examples (all must lead to the attacker able to act as Admin, with no user interaction):

  • Direct exploitation via an exposed port associated with an Endpoint Protection component.
  • Target machine receives an email from attacker triggering RCE due to Endpoint Protection processing / parsing.
  • A browser on the endpoint visits a webpage leading to code execution due to Endpoint Protection interactions with the browser or associated network traffic.

Out-of-scope examples:

  • Code execution after connecting via an authorized remote route, e.g. RDP. This is not considered a remote exploit since the RDP connection gives the attacker a presence local to the target.
  • Any attack where a user needs to enter credentials. Attacks where user interaction is required are excluded from this bounty target.
  • Any attack where code execution is obtained but not in the context of Admin.

All testing can be done with free trial versions https://www.sophos.com/en-us/products/endpoint-antivirus/free-trial of the product on the Windows platform.

IMPORTANT. All research should be done on fresh trial versions of Intercept X and when signing up for the trial, ensure your email has bugcrowdninja in the address. For example, tom+bugcrowdninja@gmail.com or bill@bugcrowdninja.com

Eligible findings are reproducible on fully patched installations of Intercept X. Sophos will not reward issues that are not reproducible in the latest release. Testing should be done on 64-bit Windows only, Windows 10 22H2 (build 19045) or later Windows 11 22H2 (build 22621) or later.

target_groups.name: Sophos Firewall Special Target
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Findings eligible for the highest payout are/come with:

  • Attack Vector: Network (WAN interface only)
  • Attack Complexity: Low (no MitM etc.)
  • Privileges Required: None (pre-auth only)
  • User Interaction: None (no phishing, etc.)
  • Impact: Code/command execution as root (CVSSv3+ C:H/I:H/A:H)
  • Reproducible on the latest maintenance release of the latest version, as published on MySophos
  • Detailed version information:
    • Login to the Device Console
    • At the console> prompt type: “system dia sh ver”
    • Add the output to the report (screenshots accepted)
  • PoC code or step by step reproduction instructions
    • May be in the form of a video
  • Tools used to detect the issue, if any
  • Information on what helped discover the issue most:
    • Root shell access
    • Reverse engineering (decompiled JARs)
    • Previously published CVE (incl. CVE ID)
    • Other (please elaborate) *Source code file and line of the issue, if possible

All testing can be done with free trial versions of the product on any available platform (software/virtual/hardware).

IMPORTANT. All research should be done on fresh trial versions and when signing up for the trial, ensure your email has bugcrowdninja in the address. For example, tom+bugcrowdninja@gmail.com or bill@bugcrowdninja.com

Eligible findings are reproducible on fully patched installations of XG Firewall (see https://community.sophos.com/kb/en-us/135415 for details). Sophos will not reward issues that are not reproducible in the latest release.

target_groups.name: Premium Bounty Eligible Targets

targets.name: Other Sophos Appliances (RED, Switch, Access Points, ...)

target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Eligible findings are/come with:

  • Reproducible on the latest maintenance release (MR) on an actively maintained product branch that is generally available (GA)
  • Detailed version information

All testing can be done with free trial versions of the product on any available platform (software/virtual/hardware/operating system).

target_groups.name: Bounty Eligible Targets

targets.name: Sophos IT Infrastructure (all other Sophos domains)
Any Other Sophos Product or Service

target_groups.descriptionHtml:
The Sophos "catch-all target" is a way to report any other issue not covered by the Premium or Out of scope targets:

  • receive rewards for P1 findings
  • Kudos points for all accepted submissions

name: Aurory Managed Bug Bounty Engagement (Public)
tagline: On a mission to reshape gaming

target_groups.name: In Scope Targets
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Target Information:

Aurory is a play-to-earn Japanese role playing game built on Solana. It is a web3 game with a marketplace and a crypto economy that rewards players with weekly distributions and more for specific events.

Players are invited to explore a rich and diverse universe where they will travel across the worlds of Antik and Tokané as they complete quests, discover lost relics, defeat enemies, and compete against other players using creatures called “Nefties". Hatch eggs to obtain new Nefties, or trade with other players to build up your elite Neftie team and battle your way to the top of the leaderboard!

The game was built using the Unity Game Engine, and the API is primarily NodeJS.

API Docs:

  • https://aggregator-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://auth-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://auth-public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://blitz-battle-public-api-citrine.live.aurory.io
  • https://land-public-api-citrine.live.aurory.io
  • https://matchmaking-public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://challenge-public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://crafting-public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://economy-public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://identity-public-api-v2.live.aurory.io
  • https://items-public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://locker-public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://login.live.aurory.io
  • https://logs.live.aurory.io
  • https://loyalty-public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://marketplace-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://marketplace-v2-public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://match-public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://matchmaking-public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://notification-public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://player-data-public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://public-api.live.aurory.io
  • https://referral-public-api.live.aurory.io

Game Client & Server

These are sample focus areas but are not an exhaustive list for the Seekers of Token game which can be downloaded on the Epic Games launcher and the servers it interacts with.

As the server for the game is not authoritative, many in-game objects can be manipulated by the client which is known.

Client-side vulnerabilities:

  • Exploitable memory leaks that crash the game or compromise user data.
  • Local file inclusion (LFI) vulnerabilities that allow unauthorized access to game files or user data.
  • Remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities that enable attackers to execute arbitrary code on the client machine.
  • Buffer overflows leading to crashes or code execution.
  • Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities that can be used to steal session cookies or inject malicious scripts into the game UI.
  • Insecure direct object references (IDOR) that allow unauthorized access to other player's data.

Server-side vulnerabilities:

  • SQL injection (SQLi) vulnerabilities that allow attackers to manipulate the game database.
  • Server-side RCE vulnerabilities that enable attackers to take control of the game server.
  • Insecure authentication and authorization flaws that allow unauthorized access to user accounts or game resources.
  • Broken object level authorization (BOLA) vulnerabilities that grant unauthorized access to user data.
  • Insecure API endpoints that can be exploited to manipulate game logic and used as unintended cheats.

Active Smart Contract in use:

  • Solana Casier (aka Locker) Smart Contract: https://solscan.io/account/CAsieqooSrgVxhgWRwh21gyjq7Rmuhmo4qTW9XzXtAvW
  • Arbitrum Casier (aka Locker) Smart Contract: https://arbiscan.io/address/0x4e0e24b960286be46ecf92986bef548604601d77

Focus Areas:

  • Transaction manipulation
    • Are you able to modify a transaction to steal tokens, or reduce the cost of a purchase?

name: Gearset: Managed Bug Bounty
tagline: Industry-leading DevOps solutions for every Salesforce team

target_groups.name: Gearset Staging
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Tech changes:

  • (Latest) We are in the process of introducing Redux.js
  • We are also moving a lot of our JS to Typescript
  • Currently migrating from Knockout.js to React

Focus area:

  • Data backups (page / docs)
  • Deployment Pipelines (page / docs)
  • Enterprise security features (page / docs / docs 2)
  • Customer data (Customer on Team A should not be able to read/modify data belonging to another customer on Team B)

target_groups.name: Gearset Public API
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Getting started

We provide a getting started guide for our customers, which explains how to create access tokens and make your first request. This can be found here.

The only difference to the above is that you should be using https://staging-api.gearset.com rather than https://staging.gearset.com to make API request, and you should be logging in our test instance.

Docs

For more information, please view our API docs.
These contain curl commands which you can use to send requests to our API.

target_groups.name: HIPAA Gearset Staging
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Summary:

The same API as Gearset Staging.
Customer accounts must be added manually by Gearset and researchers will not be given accounts, so should not be able to access any meaningful data or make any changes on this system.

target_groups.name: Out of scope targets
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Researchers should only use our staging environment. Our production environment is not to be used.

Any domain/property of Gearset not listed in the targets section is out of scope (this includes our marketing website gearset.com). This includes any/all subdomains not listed above. If you happen to identify a security vulnerability on a target that is not in-scope, but that demonstrably belongs to Gearset, it may be reported to this program, and is appreciated - but will ultimately be marked as 'not applicable' and will not be eligible for monetary or points-based compensation.

name: Luno Bug Bounty Program
tagline: Luno Bug Bounty Program

target_groups.name: Tier 1 Targets:
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Target Information:

Staging mobile apps are not currently available.
When testing the mobile applications you are testing on production. Behavior that compromises the stability and integrity of the site is out of scope. For example, do not target other user's data (use one of your other sets of credentials), delete/remove/edit parts of the site, engage any sort of DoS attack, and/or compromise any target's ability to function for other users. If you believe that you have found a vulnerability of this nature, please stop further testing and report it.

HTTP Request Headers for bonus rewards

  • While testing API and Web we incentivise utilising the following headers:

    x-luno-announcement-id: {optional - use when testing a specific announcement}

    x-luno-bugcrowd-id: {required - Bugcrowd username}

  • The utilisation of the aforementioned headers will be confirmed (and retrospectively checked to ensure that the headers were not only utilised at the tail end of testing), and if verified and submission is eligible for a payout, an additional 5% will be added as a bonus reward.

  • Header names must all be in lowercase (as is shown above).

target_groups.name: Tier 2 Targets:
target_groups.descriptionHtml: Please only test the web application and API in the staging environment.

name: Exoscale
tagline: European cloud provider. Simplicity, scalability and security.

target_groups.name: Advanced Scope - Virtualisation Layer
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
This target group focuses on more technically challenging and critical aspect of our infrastructure, hence the higher bounty ranges. Particularly, we are interested in vulnerabilities that would concern the virtualisation layer. Example of interesting vulnerabilities would be:

  • VM Breakouts
  • Container Breakouts
  • Hypervisor Level Exploitation/Access
  • Cross-Tenant Access
  • Speculative Execution Exploit

The information regarding accesses mentioned in the first target group still applies here.

target_groups.name: Main scope
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Target information

Here you can find our YouTube channel where there are talks and quickstart guides for some of our products such as the SKS Managed Kubernetes.

All Exoscale zones are in scope of this program (some of the URLs below point to "ch-gva-2" as an example).

Access:

Credentials:

Upon joining the program, each researcher will get a mailbox auto-assigned to them. Each researcher will receive automatically an email with a list of coupons that can be used to register multiple accounts on Exoscale.

Each coupon can be used once to register an account using a different email addresses. You should register using the assigned Bugcrowd email alias using the + tag capabilities for multiple accounts. Ex: curious.badger+account1@bugcrowdninja.com

If you need more coupon codes, you can contact support@exoscale.com by providing your username and @bugcrowdninja.com email address.

Treasure Map

A treasure map that contains a detailed description of our product and infrastructure is available to program participants when requesting credentials. A list of our internally used domains and IPs is also provided and define the scope that can be scanned for vulnerability. Any other IPs in our AS ranges would belong to customers and be out of scope.

By joining the program, you agree not to disclose any of the provided information.

target_groups.name: Out of Scope
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Out of scope

  • Customer infrastructure is out of scope
  • Failure to Invalidate Session issues
  • No Rate Limiting on Form issues unless the researcher can demonstrate a strong security impact
  • Vulnerabilities that only results in inconsequential losses for Exoscale (under USD 500, ex: resources or coupon limit bypass)
  • All P5 severity vulnerability as described on the Bugcrowd Vulnerability Taxonomy
  • Activities amounting to denial of services
  • Missing Secure or HTTPOnly Cookie Flag
  • Email Spoofing to Inbox due to Missing or Misconfigured DMARC on Email Domain
  • Vulnerabilities only affecting users of outdated or unpatched browsers
  • Software version disclosure
  • Very recent public vulnerability (patch available for less than 2 weeks)
  • Attacks that require unlikely user interaction

name: Lime
tagline: Help secure Lime

target_groups.name: Public In-Scope
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
All of the below targets are publicly accessible. Accounts can be provisioned where signup is available. Some of the targets will NOT have a user signup or registration process. This means it is for internal use only.

Lime Mobile Apps

Our mobile applications allow you to manage on the go. The apps are available on Android and iOS, they are a single codebase. Any issues found on backend logic in Android will also be on iOS, and vice versa. Submissions will be duplicated when submitting to either device.

Rider Application:

This is our primary customer-facing mobile application which riders use to ride Lime products. The application allows riders to manage their account, start/reserve rides, manage their Lime subscriptions, create support requests, and other tasks. The Android app uses Kotlin and Java and the iOS app uses Swift and Objective-C, powered by ruby on rails on the backend, running on Kubernetes cluster in AWS. Credentials can be provisioned in the user signup flow in the application

Supply Application (Supply One)

This is our primary operator-facing mobile application which operators use to perform operational tasks to keep the Lime fleet operational. The users of this application are Juicers and Logistical partners. The application allows operators to manage their account, perform out-of-warehouse tasks, manage their payment of how Lime pays them, provides a learning center of how to perform tasks, etc. The Android app uses Kotlin and Java and the iOS app uses Swift and Objective-C, powered by ruby on rails on the backend, running on the kubernetes cluster in AWS. Credentials can be provisioned in the user signup flow in the application.

Lime API testing

Web-production API (lime.bike)

This API is our primary backend API. It is a RESTful API. This acts as the brain of all Lime applications. These APIs serve all the features of Lime applications described above. This is developed in Ruby on Rails.

External API (lime.bike)

This API is our subset of backend APIs. It is a RESTful API. This endpoint serves Government relations requirements and Uber integration features. These APIs serves all the features of Admintool GR features and Uber app serving Lime riders. This is developed in Ruby on rails.

  • external-api.lime.bike = Uber integration API
  • Data.lime.bike = Government relations features API

Lime Bike communication

Proxy platform

This is a centralized and unified IoT Message communication between bikes and backend workflow. It is an independent and isolated IoT parser service to consolidates different types and formats of device messages into same format

  • web-message , web-message-high = Bike communication

target_groups.name: Private In-scope
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
All of the below targets are not publicly accessible. Accounts can be provisioned where signup is available. Some of the targets will NOT have a user signup or registration process. This means it is for internal use only.

Please DO NOT email Lime to create test accounts for these endpoints.

Lime Mobile Apps

Ops application (iOS only)

This is our operators' mobile application which operators use to perform operational tasks to maintain the Lime fleet. The users of this application are Operators(FTE) and Lime full-time employees(FTE). The application allows operators to manage their accounts, perform in-warehouse tasks, manage their payment of how Lime pays them, provide a learning center of how to perform tasks, etc. This app is only available on Lime company-owned devices and Lime FTE devices. iOS app uses Swift and Objective-C, powered by ruby on rails on the backend, running on the kubernetes cluster in AWS. Credentials CANNOT be provisioned in the application.

Lime Web Apps

Admintool Web application

This is our main management application which Lime employees use to configure settings of all three customer profiles. The users of this application are Lime full-time employees(FTE) and Government relations personnel of the Lime markets. The app uses Typescript and Javascript, powered by ruby on rails on the backend, running on Kubernetes cluster and served from an S3 bucket in AWS. Credentials CANNOT be provisioned at in the user signup flow of the application

LP dashboard web-application

This is our management application which logistical partners use to onboard contractors to the Supply One app. The users of this application are Logistical Partner power users. The application allows LPs to manage their contractors, assign out-of-warehouse tasks to contractors, manage their payment, see Live maps of tasks, performance insights, and task forecasting. The app uses Typescript and Javascript, powered by ruby on rails on the backend, running on Kubernetes cluster and served from an S3 bucket in AWS. Credentials CANNOT be provisioned in the user signup flow of the application

Data Portal

This is our data portal application which Lime full-time employees use to view data insights to power their decision making. The users of this application are Lime full-time employees. The application allows Lime employees to share custom dashboards, insights, and queries to corroborate their decision-making. The app uses Vue, typescript, javascript, CSS, and shell scripts. Credentials CANNOT be provisioned in the user signup flow of the application.

Inhouse deployment pipeline

The users of this application are Lime full-time employees(developers). The application allows us to manage deployments, jobs, migrations, and sandboxes at Lime. The app uses Python, HTML, Javascript, CSS, and shell scripts. Credentials CANNOT be provisioned in the user signup flow of the application.

Lime website

Website, though this is public but the main functionality resides on mobile applications. The users of this application are the general public. The application allows us to share information with the public. The app uses Twig, PHP, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS. Credentials CANNOT be provisioned in the user signup flow of the application.

Lime GPT

The users of this application are Lime full-time employees. The application allows us to use GPT-based AI methods for multiple applications including our internal knowledge chatbot, translations, feedback analysis, and photo verification. The app uses Python, streamlit, and OpenAI APIs. Credentials CANNOT be provisioned in the user signup flow of the application.

Lime API testing

  1. Help.lime.bike: FAQ for Lime applications help center
  2. ops.lime.bike = Ops application
  3. juicer.lime.bike = LP dashboard
  4. admintool.lime.bike = Admintool application

target_groups.name: Out of scope
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
All wildcard (*) operators endpoint means every other endpoint that is explicitly not mentioned In-scope is considered Out-of-Scope. For example *.lime.bike is mentioned in Out-of-scope but web-production.lime.bike and admintool.lime.bike is mentioned in In-scope. So all lime.bike endpoints that are not explicitly mentioned in-scope are out-of-scope.

The following findings are out of scope:

  1. Cookie flags on webview.lime.bike
  2. "secret" keys exposed in iOS/Android builds that we do not consider secret
  3. *.airflow.limeinternal.com [Legacy domain]
  4. help.li.me (report to zendesk)
  5. community.li.me (report to bevy)
  6. Attacks that require unauthorized access to users' clients (phones, browsers, etc)
  7. Zero-day vulnerabilities (CVEs being added to NVD or GHSA (Github security advisory) with a score of 9.5 or lower) that are less than 30 days old.
  8. Android debugging enabled
  9. Lime account MFA issues are out of scope at the present time
  10. WAF bypass
  11. Open redirects / Lack of security speedbump when leaving the site (no immediate credential leak)
  12. Internal IP address disclosure
  13. Accessible Non-sensitive files and directories (e.g. README.TXT, CHANGES.TXT, robots.txt, .gitignore, WSDL, pprof, etc.)
  14. Social engineering / phishing attacks
  15. Self XSS
  16. Text injection
  17. Email spoofing (including SPF, DKIM, DMARC, From: spoofing, and visually similar, and related issues)
  18. Descriptive error messages (e.g. stack traces, application or server errors, path disclosure)
  19. Fingerprinting/banner disclosure on common/public services
  20. Clickjacking and issues only exploitable through clickjacking
  21. CSRF issues that don't impact the integrity of an account (e.g. log-in or out, contact forms, and other publicly accessible forms)
  22. Lack of Secure and HTTPOnly cookie flags (critical systems may still be in scope)
  23. Lack of rate limiting
  24. Login or Forgot Password page brute force, account lockout not enforced, or insufficient password strength requirements
  25. HTTPS mixed content scripts
  26. Username/email enumeration by brute forcing/error messages (e.g. login/signup / forgotten password)
  27. Exceptional cases may still be in scope (e.g. ability to enumerate email addresses via incrementing a numeric parameter)
  28. Missing HTTP security headers
  29. TLS/SSL Issues, including BEAST BREACH, insecure renegotiation, bad cipher suite, expired certificates, etc.
  30. Denial of Service attacks
  31. Out-of-date software
  32. Use of a known-vulnerable component (exceptional cases, such as where you are able to provide proof of exploitation, may still be in scope)
  33. Physical attacks against Lime's Facilities / Property /Assets

name: Infinite Athlete
tagline: Infinite Athlete is the technological vanguard for the sports and entertainment industry. Merging sports, video, and data with innovation and accessibility, Tempus Ex technology enables the creation of new interactive experiences around live events.

target_groups.name: In Scope Targets
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Properties associated with the targets below are considered within scope as well, so long as they are owned by Infinite Athlete. If you are unsure of whether a property is owned by Infinite Athlete, please contact us.

Please note:
No credentials (including API Keys) will be provided for testing on these targets.

name: Ibotta
tagline: Mobile app providing cash back for users through in-app purchases, loyalty card integrations, payments, and receipt scanning.

target_groups.name: In Scope Targets
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
The web APIs are updated daily, and the mobile app is updated bi-weekly. In the event you don't find anything today, there may be something present tomorrow and as such, vulnerability reports on these targets are of the highest impact to the Ibotta team and have a higher reward range!

The Chrome extension was recently moved out of Beta so we are particularly interested in testing that ensures the pop-up interaction with their other product areas (such as the next item or loyalty card linking) is secure and would like to know about any sensitive data exposure.

name: Ultra Mobile Managed Bug Bounty Program - Retailer Portal
tagline: Ultra Mobile is a telecom company with tech sensibilities, always iterating on our latest achievements to make better products, provide better service and better customer experience. Please submit your findings to this Bug Bounty Program.

target_groups.name: Ultra Mobile's retailer portal
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Target Information:
This target is used by retailers/resellers to manage Ultra Mobile SIMS.
The underlying API for this website is GraphQL and is also in scope.

Access will be via the website at:
https://web-retailer-portal.ultramobile.com

name: New Relic Public Bug Bounty Program
tagline: Data for engineers to monitor, debug, and improve their entire stack.

target_groups.name: Tier One Targets
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Target Information:

New Relic One:
New Relic One is the industry’s first entity-centric observability platform. This platform allows our customers to view across accounts and products. Assets in both the North American and European region are in scope for our bug bounty program, except where otherwise noted.

  • New Relic allows sign-in via direct login, SSO, and social logins.
    • When logging in via social login, it is expected that the session will persist as long as the third party service still has a valid session.
  • All services can be found at: https://one.newrelic.com/all-capabilities
  • New Relic software distributed via GitHub can be found at: https://github.com/newrelic
    • New Relic agents, both infrastructure and language, are used to send information (running processes, memory usage, etc.) from the system where they are installed to be viewed within the New Relic web application.
    • We may provide rewards for security issues found within our agents that could reduce the security of the application the agent is integrated with. Rewards are based on the default configuration settings, but agents that show problems due to a configuration change may be eligible for a reward.
  • Synthetics minions are sandboxed virtual machines that run monitors (scripts) to gather information about your websites, critical business transactions, and API endpoints. Minions can run in our data center or privately within your own infrastructure. We recommend familiarizing yourself with the product by reading our documentation.
    • Note that out-of-date packages running on these minions are not in scope for this program. Minions are intended to be updated from within the VM or with future releases.
  • The New Relic agents are designed to collect data and send it back for display within the New Relic products. Traffic between the agents and New Relic backend services may be inspected and reports concerning issues with how the agent connects and transports information are acceptable.

New Relic Mobile Applications:

  • The New Relic Android app and New Relic iOS App lets you access your data wherever you are. Receive alerts, view, query, and share dashboards, and more all from your mobile device.

Tier One Agents (with documentation references):

  • Infrastructure agents - The New Relic Infrastructure agents are used to send information (running processes, memory usage, etc.) from Windows and Linux servers to be viewed within the New Relic One platform.
  • Browser agent - The New Relic Browser agent is deployed as a JavaScript snippet by way of a supported APM agent or web application. It is designed to collect data about the running application and send it back for display within the New Relic One platform
  • Android agent - The New Relic Android agent is installed via Gradle within a supported Android application. It is designed to collect data about the running application and send it back for display within New Relic Mobile.
  • iOS agent - The New Relic iOS agent is installed as a framework or via CocoaPods within a supported iOS application. It is designed to collect data about the running application and send it back for display within New Relic Mobile.
  • Go agent - The New Relic Go agent is installed within a supported Go application. It is designed to collect data about the running application and send it back for display within New Relic APM.
  • Node.js agent - The New Relic Node.js agent can by installed via npm within a supported Node.js application. It is designed to collect data about the running application and send it back for display within the New Relic One platform.
  • Ruby agent - The New Relic Ruby agent is installed as a Ruby gem within a supported Ruby application. It is designed to collect data about the running application and send it back for display within the New Relic One platform.
  • Unity agent - The New Relic Unity agent is installed within a Unity application on iOS or Android. It is designed to collect data about the running application and send it back for display within the New Relic One platform.
  • PHP agent - The New Relic PHP agent can be installed within a supported PHP application. It is designed to collect data about the running application and send it back for display within the New Relic One platform.

target_groups.name: Tier Two Targets
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Target Information:

New Relic website:

  • All assets under www.newrelic.com are in scope for our bug bounty program, except where otherwise noted.
    • Services hosted by third party providers are out of scope and should not be tested against.

New Relic blog:

  • Our blog is hosted externally by Pantheon. Issues within this application or regarding our content should be reported here. No security testing should be done against the platform itself. Any security issues found within the platform should be reported directly to Pantheon.
    • Unregistered domains or social media accounts linked from this domain are not in scope for bounty.

New Relic Support websites:

  • Includes support.newrelic.com, forum.newrelic.com, knowledge. newrelic.com
    • These sites are built on the Salesforce Experience Cloud platform. Issues unique to our installation are in scope for bounties.
      • Issues with Salesforce itself are not in scope and should not be researched on our instance.
    • Spam, brute forcing, and social engineering are strictly forbidden. All care should be made to avoid generating new posts or otherwise affecting the experience of other users on the forum.
      • Note: No XSS payloads should be attempted unless there is reason to believe our instance is uniquely vulnerable due to our modifications. If an issue is discovered, the payload should immediately be deleted and reported to prevent other users from encountering it.

New Relic University:

  • Our training portal is hosted externally by Skilljar. Issues within this application or regarding our content should be reported here.
    • No security testing should be done against the platform itself. Any security issues found within the platform should be reported to the Skilljar security team.

targets.name: New Relic open source software repos in github.com not in the list of agents or on docs.newrelic.com; New Relic Example Code, New Relic Experimental and Archived repos are explicitly out of scope.

name: SAP Private Invitation
tagline: Join SAP's bug bounty programs

target_groups.name: Our products

targets.name: SAP Integrated Business Planning for Supply Chain
SAP Customer Data Cloud portfolio from Gigya
SAP Order Management for Sourcing and Availability

target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Disclaimer

Each SAP product is different and rewards may vary between engagements. We aim to offer competitive rewards and promotions on a regular basis. Our highest paying engagements offers up to $15,000 for P1 findings!

targets.name: All submissions reported to this program will be marked as Not Applicable

name: Upwork
tagline: Upwork invites researchers to test our marketplace and apps to ensure a secure, vulnerability-free platform for our users

target_groups.name: In scope
target_groups.descriptionHtml: Focus Area: Recently migrated from Angular to Vue.js and findings related to this change are of great interest to the Upwork team

target_groups.name: Non-Circumvention Controls Targets
target_groups.descriptionHtml:
Scope Description

  • For this scope, we're inviting researchers to test our existing User Agreement Non-Circumvention Controls on our Marketplace and mobile iOS/Android/Desktop apps, as well as help us to discover unknown loopholes that can be exploited to gain directs access or share contact information. Our goal is to ensure that our clients and freelancers are using our platform in compliance with User Agreement Section 7 specifically.

Special Bonuses and Rewards

  • Ongoing and until we reward $10000 total for all submissions reported under this sub-program. We may extend this program in the future based on results.
    • Momentum Bonus, the more you submit, the more you earn!
    • There is a 7-day sliding window where you can build momentum on your rewards for this program, going forward, submissions made within the 7-day sliding window will be sorted by the severity assigned and the momentum bonus will be applied from highest to lowest severity, for example if you submit 3 bugs in this sequence [P3, P2, P1] within a 7 day sliding window, the submissions will be sorted by severity [P1, P2, P3] and the first (Bug with P1 Severity) pays 100%, the second (Bug with P2 Severity) pays 110%, the third (Bug with P3 Severity) pays 120%, etc. This scales to a maximum payout amount of 200% (double reward) the original value.

Disclosure Terms

  • This program has a coordinated disclosure policy. Disclosure requests will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.

target_groups.name: Out of Scope

targets.name: Any subdomain/domain/property not listed in the 'in scope' section, is out of scope.

target_groups.descriptionHtml:
• All already known loopholes and planned remediation will not be rewarded.
  • Brute Forcing credentials to break into accounts is outside of scope.
  • The use of Social Engineering is out of scope.
  • Soliciting circumvention as a means of root cause identification.
  • Finding direct contact information through externally posted sources by either client or freelancer is out of scope unless this information is clearly linked from within the Upwork Marketplace and was not known to Upwork trust and safety teams already.

name: Tamedia
tagline: Tamedia is the leading private media group in Switzerland

tagline: Submit your finding to the program!

tagline: Carrefour UAE
